text: Great place! The decor and vibe is great and welcoming. Good choice to try all vegan for the first time. Food was amazing! I recommend the hot honee sandwich with the potato salad. Delish.
Went for lunch, was seated & order was taken, then the waitress comes back from the kitchen and informs us that they have no cook and didn't know when they would have one.

12 Nov 24  Modern Love in Midtown Crossing (MC) is Closing.
.  Business turnover is normal. But the pace of turnover for MC appears to be accelerating.
.  Remember Arlan's, Alamo, Garbo's, Going Postal, Ingredient, Wohlner's, etal.
.  WHY?!

12 Nov 2024   Modern Love at Midtown Crossing has announced it is closing.
.  Modern Love provides an important alternative dining opportunity.
.  It will be missed.
This is the best vegan restaurant for comfort food, hands down!

I got the nachos for lunch and garlic Alfredo pasta for dinner the next night. That pasta was so yummy even a day later! The nachos were very filling. Food was good, the price was a bit higher than I thought, especially for Omaha. When I entered the restaurant, it reeked of sulfur, so I’m not sure if it’s normally like that. My server was very nice to me and the food came out pretty quickly. I’m happy a fully vegan restaurant exists in Omaha. Highly recommend the Alfredo pasta and nachos! I’d probably order takeaway if the restaurant still smells like sulfur.

This is one of the few (basically only) vegan restaurants in Omaha and I want to give it 5 stars so bad but I've had some pretty big issues with menu availability and service. For example, one day when when I had about an hour to get in and out my table ordered a few appetizers and drinks and nothing ever came. We ended up still paying and got some food put into to-go containers but no one working offered any other solution besides us paying for the food. Also multiple times when I've tried to order speciality meals for take out (that say they're available) I'll get calls saying the items aren't and their website never updates with that info. My final concern is the rising prices and what feels like smaller portion sizes for some of their meals.

I will continue to recommend this restaurant because we need more vegan options for people and hopefully they can fix some of these issues.
Food was disappointing.  I've had more gourmet vegan food from chain restaurants (ex. Cheesecake Factory).

I've had meatless nachos from coast to coast and these are BY FAR the most excellent nachos of them all. The chili burger is also incredible, especially with a side of potato salad. Highly recommend!
Edit: We went back and had Mac n Chews, fried mozzarella balls and pumpkin milkshakes. Everything was incredible as always!
Great food!

Great find!

Went in for a business meeting and the other two people I went with recommended this place.

I ordered a Hot Chicken Sandwich (or something like that) and split the Mac and Cheese with wings with my boyfriend.

The Mac and Cheese was soooooo good. Very flavorful and the wings were so tasty.

The sandwich was delicious and the salad was great.

I really wanted the Feta and Strawberry salad but they were out of it and none of the other salads interested me.

I wish I would’ve had room for dessert as it all looked amazing.

The place is cute and prices were decent. Service was good.

I’ll definitely be back when I’m visiting Omaha!

A fantastic restaurant with delicious food and great gluten-free options! Though I’m not usually a fan of tofu, the hot honey sandwich was crispy and flavorful. We also tried a spiked shake, which was excellent. The house-made sauces were a highlight—I’m not typically into ketchup, but theirs was outstanding. With great service and reasonable prices, it was an all-around enjoyable experience!
Did a curbside pickup and ordered their vegan cheese burger with a side order of brussel sprouts. Very good food!

Non vegan here, they know what they are doing fantastic service and food, presentation is not a priority for me but I really appreciate that my meal was as aesthetic as it was tasteful, it is a rarity for dine-in let alone take out was thouroughly impressed!

I was so excited to go to this place, but was so disappointed. What I ordered was horrible. The Goddess bowl smelled burnt and tasted burnt, including the rice (which was crunchy). It also included brussel sprouts (not on menu description) which I hate. They have GF options but not very many! And offer a GF bun, but it’s kind of pointless since the vegan meats all have gluten. The “milk”shake was okay and the curry my daughter got was decent (rice was again terrible). Decor was on point. But for a $50 ticket (that I don’t mind paying for a good vegan meal!) I left hungry. Will not visit again :(
Foods here so good. 👍
The food was okay, I was disappointed. They were WAY overpriced! Service was good.

As a disclaimer, we typically only leave reviews for places that are either excellent or a big flop.  We decided to try this place while visiting Omaha due to many excellent reviews. We've been cooking plant-based for around 4 years and, honestly, skip this place. Save yourself a lot of money and cook at home. They do validate parking, though.
Special place, worth the price!

Aren't we all lucky that in the Northeastern corner of Nebraska, there's an all-vegan restaurant serving creative and delicious vegan comfort food? There's nothing to be said about good old MoLo that hasn't already been said...They're a staple of Omaha. They're a treasure of Nebraska. A bit pricey to go there more often but worth it at least a few times every now and then.

Recommendations: Fried Mozzarella, Beet Reuben, Mac and Shews, Shakes

📸Butterfly Lemonade - so yummy - and the quote on the wall at Modern Love (Omaha) "Always take a big bite it's such a gorgeous sight."📸 The chef prepares delicious vegan dishes that are appealing to the palate and the eyes. We enjoy chatting with Jen, the server, as she always remembers us when we come in. She is attentive, warm, and friendly. Been to both MOLOs, Omaha and NYC, and both are great!
Best vegan food around! It’s an Omaha staple!!

100% Vegan restaurant .
Went to Modern Love for my daughter's birthday. It was quite the experience being that I'm not vegan but I did try a little bit of everything. I was pretty impressed. The food was very tasty, a lot of good flavor. I'm not a fan of tofu but it's probably a texture thing. The service was amazing. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and helpful with the menu items. I loved the dreamy atmosphere...it was comfy and relaxing.

We're on our yearly trip to Omaha from Minnesota. We always go to Modern Love multiple times each visit. We did brunch twice and dinner once and ordered two dinners to drive home with. The food here is perfect and 100% vegan..Thank you to our wonderful
server, Jen who took us all three times!
ML never disappoints. I had the hot dog lunch special today, tried the bahn mi dog and cookout dog. So good!

This was quite literally the worst experience I have ever had at a resturaunt. It took them 25 minutes to even greet me when I sat down, i had to get up & serve my own water & when I ordered my food they brought out something completely different & asked me if that was okay AFTER ALREADY BRINGING THE WRONG FOOD OUT. The food was TERRIBLE & the service was something out of this world. There are no words to describe how awful this experience was. Do not come here if you are coming to Omaha.

I really enjoyed my sandwich and fries, but I found a hair in my
strawberry milkshake and they didn't even bring me a new one. The waitress avoided me despite me being high polite when bringing it to her attention. Disappointing because I had high hopes for this place.

I ordered the parmesan brussels and the fettuccine Alfredo. $40 on UberEats and they won't refund me. The brussels were wrong from their prep. They didn't care enough to take all the leaves off or.. the stems?? Not to mention even cooking them. You can tell when something is cooked. Besides all of that, the seasoning? Well, just look at my photo. They were not good. Pasta was 1/4 hot arugula and a somehow cold, chewy slice of toasted bread.. but it, itself, was hot and tasted ok... until I started crying from the raw garlic. I was thinking why is this Alfredo spicy?? It's "roasted" garlic. Please. I can't make this up. There's a HUGE difference between soft, buttery, roasted garlic and a raw clove. I'm SO GLAD I didn't feed this to my kids. We're traveling and were so glad to find a vegan option but this was NOT it.
Delicious food and lots of options! The vibe of MOLO is unmatched

The food was good but when I was eating the bbq cauliflower wings there was a long hair under one of them. I know it was not mine. So gross. Please wear hairnets I didn’t want to finish the meal and it was so expensive. The restaurant was already closed by the time i got home with my food so I couldn’t call but please be aware.

Quality keeps going down, i always think it will turn around, or at least stay at the same quality, but everytime I go back it gets worse. From burnt, to barely cooked, to big straight ripped off…. It has come to the point I don’t think I will ever order again. So sad to lose a vegan restaurant….

I'm not a vegetarian but I love the food here. So fresh and so tasty. I got a burger and a side of fries to go and everything was delicious! The hot honey drizzle was amazing, as were the fries that were seasoned to perfection. 🍯

The staff is amazing but the food is even better. I had the Caesar salad, it was so amazing with fresh capers and homemade cheese- the portions were generous and it was gone before I knew it. The staff was so nice, the waiter recently made full time and his birthday was today- he seemed very happy to be there, and assured me that he was going to celebrate.
Love this place. The food is incredible. The employees are even better. A regular stop every time I'm in Omaha.

Fantastic vegan full of flavor food

Very nice decor
Very clean
Nice music
Nice staff
Excellent fast service
Food was good. I wanted more flavor overall. The nachos were excellent.

"This vegan restaurant is super nice! The food and drinks are awesome, with flavors that really stand out. It's an upscale place, but it still feels relaxed and welcoming. The views are great, adding to the whole experience. Whether you're going for a special occasion or just a nice night out, this place won't disappoint. The atmosphere, the tasty vegan dishes, and the overall vibe make it a spot you’ll want to come back to again and again."

No customer  service had to call  restaurant to get help from employee no manager only one employee  and cook. Cook came UT and didn't talk to any customer. Don't see restaurant lasting long if the keep go this way.

I ate here over a year ago and I thought the food was good and I actually gave it five stars at that time, but I returned a couple of days ago and ordered the mushroom Swizz burger and it was just horrible. The entire Patty was burned completely black, and they actually even burned the inside of the hamburger bun. See the pictures. Also, the fries are not fresh. They are so heavily filled with oil and very dry and heavily salted, like they've just been kept in the fryer for way too long. I couldn't eat about 3/4 of them. I asked for a lime sparkling water, and thought it was just going to be lime flavored sparkling water. Instead, it was filled with so much lime juice and was so bitter it wasn't drinkable. When I got to the restaurant with my son, no one was at the front greeting customers, and after we arrived several other customers arrived, and still no one had shown up after five minutes to greet any of the customers. I literally had to go search the restaurant for someone to seat us and the other people. I've never had such a bad experience at a vegan restaurant. Even sn impossible burger at Burger King is better than the food that I paid over $50 here. The quality of the food does not merit the price charged.  I would never come back here again. I forgot to mention that the bathrooms are almost completely dark. They have one little light on over the sink but the entire stall of the bathroom is in darkness which if someone is older and they can't see well could really pose a hazard. This is so unacceptable see photos.
Outstanding vegan restaurant! Awesome kale salad, chickpea cutlet Parmesan, tofu rancheros, chocolate swirl shake.

We arrived at 530pm on a weekday. Our party booked ahead and had 2 fettuccine with the chickpea chix addition, eggplant parm, 2 of the mushroom mashed potato dish, some kind of salad with grilled tofu.

Pros - vegan, good variety, friendly staff, not busy at all, food seemed to come in a timely manner, most of the food looked and tasted good if you didn't eat too much ... and even though I live elsewhere, this is near my dad's house.

Cons - I rarely have heartburn but I had it that night and the next morning ... boo! There was a lot of heavy food (fried and/or with a rich sauce) - most of it tasted really good (the grilled tofu tasted burnt) but was so heavy it was difficult to eat until full; either the oil was off or the food was fried too long (??? something wasn't right); the staff did zero pre-busing, so all of our empty plates and cups sat there while we visited after the meal - it's like they forgot about us. And, in my opinion, the atmosphere has unappetizing colors.

Because of the heartburn reaction, I probably will not be coming back. In the future, I might try again but find something that isn't covered in sauce or fried ... or with the burnt-tasting grilled tofu.

Fantastic food: The hot new chicken and nachos were amazing; the kale salad a little too salty. Service was hit and miss; the guy leaving his shift completely ignored me while the lady who just got there was the nicest and gave me fantastic service. It looked clean but bathrooms were dark with a sticky floor. I would eat here again (that sandwich!) but just as likely to try other vegan restaurants in town next time. Parking and construction is also an issue; you can choose the garage and get validated.

One of the few places in town with a wide range of food options for dietary restrictions (e.g. vegetarian, vegan, GF, DF). Can be a bit pricey but is a great option for a date night or to try something new and local!

I got the hot honee sandwich, which to be fair I got it to go but it was very messy. They didn’t give me any napkins either. I also got the buffalo wings, they were just ok too. Next time I would definitely eat there instead of taking it to go.
The best things were the Gluten Free Buffalo Wings and garlic Alfredo pasta 😋
We got a pint of their ice cream. While it was delicious, it looks like the workers got extremely lazy when putting it together. My pint was barely filled. Disappointed
The food was great and the service was excellent.  The location is great. Inside is cute but a bit hot and the bathrooms were very dark. Will definitely visit again. Butterfly lemonade is great!
Awesome and delicious! Great service too
Lovely place
This place cares about allergies, especially gluten and dairy. I've never been a Vegan but this place actually had me considering it lol. Their fries are the best!!! I will be back!
Fullfilled the need for vegan food while passing through. Great taste, good portions. My goddess bowl didn't have the pepitas or microgreens though which was disappointing.

If you are vegan or enjoy eating vegan. Highly highly recommend. Went with friends and tried several of the entrees and desserts for dinner. There was not a bad taste in the lot. Price was compostable to other all vegan restaurants. They were out of a couple of drinks and one dessert but what we got instead more than made up for it.

Super allergy friendly and accommodating, vegan (dairy free), gluten free, drinks where awesome! Big portions too!! Don't remember the last time I've had a shake or Mac and cheese I haven't had to make myself, nachos where to die for, overall excellent vegan cheese

From the moment I walked in, I knew I had found something special.  The staff was warm, inviting, and knowledgeable.  I had the opportunity to connect with Liam and every single thing he recommended was absolutely wonderful.  I have been a vegetarian my whole life and this Vegan restaurant is one of the best.  I highly recommend the crispy tofu; it is the best I have ever had.
I enjoyed my experience.  The food was great, especially for my first vegan meal.
A modern vegan eatery with beer and wine options in the city. Great use of different vegan meats to create perfect meals.

Made a trip to Omaha to make a boat purchase. That didn't work out but no regrets -- brunch at Modern Love more than made up for the boat disappointment.
We enjoyed Nachos Molo and the Seitan Beet Reuben which was more than enough for two people. Only suggestion is to request mustard for the Reuben as it could use just a bit more of a flavor kick.
Will definitely return should we be in Omaha again.
One of these times I will get something other than the Reuben, but it’s just SO good!

Food was okay. I love to eat vegan most of the time, but I was a little underwhelmed here. By far the best thing I had was the crispy fried tofu. But the Mac and shews were just ok and definitely felt overpriced.

Also I went home feeling bloated, which is very unusual for me.
Absolutely best vegetarian appetizers and main dishes with a cool vibe and friendly team passionate about delivering an awesome experience.

We came right of our way to check this place out. There was only one server and there were a lot of lunch time customers so it was pretty slow.
We shared the Kale salad and chicken sandwich.  It was more than enough food, and they were both huge portions.  The thing we didn't like was that everything was pretty heavy in terms of the sauces and amount of oil used in cooking.
I couldn't finish as I prefer fresh food, but for comfort food, it was pretty good.
I can see why it is a popular choice.
The venue is great, and it is easy to park.

Atmosphere is beautiful. Mushroom Swiss burger and green goddess bowl were absolutely awful. The Smokey flavor tasted like straight up butane. Not sure the cooking process but may be an inexperienced cook torching too closely to the food. Either way, highly inedible. The ingredients were quality, so it was a shame. Server spilled entire ketchup on my pants - which accidents happen, but would’ve liked to be taken care of a little more than just given napkins. Service was slow as well. Highly disappointing experience cuz I can tell there’s potential here.
Great atmosphere and staff, food was great too, but I think I ordered the wrong thing for myself!  Had the chicken and waffles.

My S.O and I have been loyal patrons of this vegan restaurant for several years, drawn in by their innovative menu that seemed to promise exciting vegan versions of popular fast food items. Unfortunately, our experience has been marred by inconsistencies and poor customer service. Initially, we were thrilled with their breakfast crunch wraps, a staple for our Saturday mornings, only for them to be abruptly discontinued without explanation. When inquired, the staff dismissively claimed that the item was rarely ordered, which was surprising given its apparent popularity.

A more recent finale straw so to say came with their special copycat menu featuring vegan alternatives to well-known Taco Bell and McDonald's items. After enjoying these options for two consecutive days, we were disappointed to find the entire menu had been removed. Despite being assured by the staff that these items would remain available, they have yet to reappear. Each interaction leaves us feeling disregarded, with staff members appearing indifferent to our concerns.

While we are passionate about supporting vegan businesses, the lack of stable menu options and the dismissive attitude of the staff have led us to explore other vegan venues. We hope that in the future, this restaurant will consider maintaining popular dishes and fostering a more respectful dialogue with their patrons.
Saw this was well rated and really enjoyed on our visit. Shared nachos, french toast and a shake as a family and they were all delicious and filling! Planning to return to try more options!
Tasty vegan food and the employees are super friendly. One of our favorite restaurants.

I'm disappointed to write this review because Modern Love has long been one of my favorite restaurants in Omaha. However, our recent visit left much to be desired. My wife and I went there last night for a special occasion, but the experience didn't live up to our expectations.

The Buffalo Wings (seitan) were overcooked, hard, and dry. The Garlic Parmesan Brussels were soggy and overly oily. Even the Goddess Bowl, which I usually love, tasted quite bland. The only dish that retained any of Modern Love's usual excellence was the Eggplant Parmesan.

Additionally, our server seemed flustered and inexperienced, forgetting our orders and dropping cutlery. It was a disappointing evening at a place we once cherished.

Although I'm not a huge fan of beets, I ordered the Beet Reuben. I would eat this every day if I could. Hands down, the best beet dish and the best overall sandwich I've ever had. The Kale Caesar was also top notch. The staff is very friendly and there was no waiting for a lunch table. 💯

If youre so used to complex flavor this is not your kind of food. Not to say that non-vegan is better because I grew up eating vegan that made by buddhist monk and local chef in asia and they are just so addictive.

I order the garlic Alfredo dish and I felt like im eating a tub of cream and italian seasoning herbs.

I really thought this is a life changing experience because there were so much hype about this restaurants. Im just gunna say it. If you into bland vegan food or just very mild in flavor ? This is your destination.

I probably wont coming back again tho.  the quality and everything else is good but flavor wise? not so much. its just not my taste bud

Just had my first experience here (and hopefully not my last), and WOW! The staff is so accommodating (shoutout to our waitress Gabby), atmosphere is stylish, cozy, and welcoming, and the food came out so quick and SO tasty. My wish is that this place expands to more locations.
Amazing selection of entirely vegan food, great service and the food came out FAST. Reasonable prices, will definitely come here again.

I am sad writing this post. As someone who is allergic to dairy and has several friends and family members that have gluten intolerances, it’s hard to find a good place we can all eat at. I’ve been to Modern Love more than 5 times in the last 3 years and every time I’ve gone, it’s worse. They are always out of food and the quality is not what it used it be. I wish they had more consistency and gluten free options. For the price, it’s now hard to justify going back if they are out of the food that is on the menu.

I wish I could give this place 10 stars. I'm still thinking about it. This is the best vegan food I've had since moving out of California. I wanted to eat at this place for every single meal. So so good I'm disappointed I don't live in the area or I would be here all the time. Vegan and gluten-free options.
Great vegetarian lovers restaurant

Loved this experience. Went with a large group and got to try a bunch of things. I loved all of them. Nachos were delicious. Brussel Sprouts had a yummy garlic flavor. Chickpea Parm sandwich had a delightful pesto and the same amazing tomato sauce that was on the eggplant parmesan. The waitstaff were fantastic with our large, kinda noisy group. Eating vegan in Omaha hasn't been easy. This place really made my trip.

Truly exceptional food. A little slow, but quality makes up for it. Tried most of the menu, over-ate, had a great time.

Buff cauli: 10/10
Buff seitan: 8/10

I recently popped out for a last minute dinner at Modern Love and it was the highlight of my week. The food is vegan and unlike other vegan options, this food satisfies BOTH the comfort food cravings and the desire for light and healthy options. My typical go-to is the Mac n shews dish. You cannot go wrong with this MOLO staple. On this visit I was feeling wild and shared a plate of nachos with my friend and enjoyed every bite. I had the  passion fruit margarita and my friend had the gimlet drink and oh goodness, both were Devine. I love Modern Love staples and I’m excited to continue to try new items  in the menu. Thanks for gracing Omaha with your beauty and talent, Isa! Also! Our server was cute as a button and so great at her job and I wish I could’ve taken her home in a to-go box. 10/10
Love this place. The food is always delicious! And the staff are always friendly and attentive.

Never a bad meal and consistently good service. I recommend the Mac and Shews and Molo Nachos. My only gripe is that they no longer serve Il Cuore, but it's certainly not a deal breaker! A bit pricey, so eating at MoLo is an occasional treat, but it's worth every penny.

In my experience, vegan restaurants are a hit or miss. Not Modern Love. After recently going vegan and feeling utter despair at the lack of available plant based options around, Modern Love has become my saving grace. Not only is everything on the menu vegan, they have gluten free options as well. Plus everything there is delicious, with their Ruben being my new favorite. Some people might scoff at the price, but you really can’t find food like theirs anywhere else. Plus it’s super cute inside!!

Sadly disappointed. Was up to try some vegan food but it did not deliver. The biggest thing was that these were recreations of non vegan dishes to be vegan. Almost everything had an aftertaste that just left me feeling disgusted about myself. I wish there were more options that were not re-creations. The atmosphere was pretty cool loved the purple vibes
Lives up to the hype! Best fettuccine alfredo I've ever had. I do wish they had NA cocktails and wine.

I went here with a friend and loved the vibe. Service was fairly quick, and the waiter was nice. We ordered poutine as an appetizer, and it was delicious! I tried their Mac ‘n Shews, which was good, but a little much if you ate the whole bowl. My friend ordered the Goddess Bowl, but it was just OK. Pesto could’ve been better, but the Brussel sprouts were nice. Overall, the food was pretty good. Left full and satisfied!

The food was mediocre. Everything we had outside the seitan wings was underseasoned, especially noticeable on the fries. Trim the stems out of your Brussel sprouts. The cheesecake was pretty good.

Service was okay, our server disappeared for 7 or 8 minutes after our food was delivered and our water glasses sat empty during that window.

Atmosphere wasn't great, the place feels like a business major's idea of a restaurant.

This was my first time here. I ordered the seitan wings and the Reuben Sandwich were fantastic. The food was quick and service was attentive and fast. Great place to eat I can't wait to try other menu options.

Our visit was so disappointing. The bathrooms were dirty. The water cups we were given were also dirty and had lipstick on them. The food lacked flavor as well and it was really expensive.

Overall a bad representation of vegan food. Just a bad experience overall.
Fried oyster mushroom with gravy . Vegan cheese balls vegan cheesecake
Our favorite place, excellent service.
Delicious food,  amazing mimosa and top notch servicer Tang.

The food is great! Service is horrible!!!!! Sat here for an hour w no food....25 min before someone took our order...watched other people's order taken that came in after. Makes me sad to think service is sooo terrible I don not want to come back here.

Sat at the bar with a non vegan buddy. Had some beers, had the fried mozzarella, and had Brussel sprouts to start. The Brussel sprouts were amazing. I ordered the seitan beet Reuben. It was really delicious and filling. The number of fries they give you are out of those world and delicious. Ultimately, everything was super delicious. I just think the mozzarella could be a little more melty like miyokos. Service was awesome.

I wouldnt know how the food tastes. I walked in at 7pm on a Wednesday night and the bartender told me the kitchen is too overwhelmed and not taking any more food orders for the night. Place was not packed.

Unfortunately I am not pleased with the experience of Modern Love as of 2-16-2024, 6:10pm.  I called in my order( seitan swiss burger and fries). It was not ready on time which was fine, I understand when things get busy, NONE THE LESS, if I must wait a extra 20minutes can the food (fries and burger) be hot? Those fries were so burnt and cold it made no sense. As I tried calling from the parking right outside I could get no one to answer the phone....it was cold so I headed home. Come on Modern Love for those prices I believe you can at least serve flavorful HOT non burnt food. It's 2024.......no substandard ANYTHING. DO better.👍

This is a difficult review to write since I've enjoyed coming here the last few years, but now it seems that the quality of everything is really slipping during our last couple of visits.  Food: the seitan wings are always a solid winner and is doing a lot of heavy lifting for the remainder of this review.  They drastically changed the reuben sandwich; it used to be very convincing and full of flavor, but now it's just a bland beet sandwich.  The bread that came with the alfredo was just awful; it tasted like an ashtray that lingered around all the way home.  The menu selection has also been reduced, which is fine if the remaining items continued to be good, if not better.  Service: it's a revolving door for servers; they're always new and confused, and they don't stick around.  Atmosphere: all the hanging plants along the windows are dead and rotting, which is rather unappealing to look at while eating.  All these issues point to a significant management problem.  I'd really like so see this place to excel, but, man, things are not looking good at the moment.
Love, love, love Modern Love! The food is fabulous, the servers are friendly, and the prices are reasonable.

The food is OK. Being the only real vegan restaurant in Omaha I wish this place was better. The food is Good, but you can tell it is not made to order. Example, we order the nachos with chorizo. You could tell the vegan chorizo was premade and the chips were not fried fresh. We have high standards when we pay premium prices.

pretty good food if you don't mind the sulfur smell in the restaurant, the aggressive upselling (new server), forgetting the pen dropping off the check, not filling waters often, forgetting a sauce we ordered and having it end up on the check, and having 3 different servers serve you during your stay

Called the restaurant twice yesterday. Left a message for callback. Also sent a message to the email that they requested if you had questions. No response what so ever!!! I have a gift card to use or I would never go back. This exact situation happened to my husband and I about 2 yrs ago. Poor business practice. I worked in the service industry for many many years and NEVER would I completely ignore a potential guest.

RATIONAL REVIEW of Modern Love

FOOD: Vegan restaurant with 5 main entrée dishes. I got the Eggplant Parmesan, which arrived warm, not hot. The flavors were good barring the garlic bread which was burnt and tasted similar to how hot tar smells. The drink choices are great, and I enjoyed the rhubarb tea!

Service: extremely slow on this particular occasion. We arrived at 6:50 and did not see our food until 8:20. Waitress was clearly overworked.

Atmosphere: tables and chairs were very petite, atmosphere was trendy and well decorated. Bathroom was pretty gross.

Overall I shall never return, but at least I got a chance to review it!
Never disappoints! More delicious every time  I’m here. My odd requests were met with no issues. Thank you Heather for the patience and great service!

Had some of the best nachos. I would highly recommend Modern Love for great food and service.

Amazing, delicious, and vegan???? I was never really one for going out of my way for vegan food but this place consistently knocks it out of the park! Great staff and atmosphere. A little pricy but so worth it!

I had a mushroom burger and my wife had a salad. Both were delicious.
Staff seemed very friendly.
Price is a bit higher than regular food, but the quality is there.

Getting seated is always hard because the food is so good. They seem to be busy all the time. The waiting is worth it. Food seems to get better every time we visit. "BBQ Wings" are delicious. Gnocchi is incredible.

We've enjoyed MOLO's food and service since it opened at its original location, but the service has become complacent... On our last visit, on Sun 2/26/23, the server was very inattentive, had no communication, and had a lack of urgency. We had to flag her down for coffee refills (repeatedly, and wait almost 40 min the first time) or anything else we needed. Added to our coffee woes, this restaurant doesn't seem to have the means to simply warm up icy creamer for our coffee. She made it seem like an impossible and unreasonable task. In addition, by the time we got the butter (which we had to ask for as well) our waffles were as cold as the refrigerated butter and syrup we were given. There's a few things more that reflect bad service, but I'll stop complaining. Most of MOLOs food is great (when it's on time and not cold), but their service is lacking. Not all service costs the restaurant money, just some attention and consideration. This has been experienced before this visit. Isa, your staff as a whole needs formal server and customer service training. Taking my order and bringing out my food with a smile isn't enough.

Stopped here for some dinner this evening and not only had delicious food, but loved the service! Lynn told us she was the only server there that night, but was flying from table to table with a great attitude and we were never kept waiting. Would absolutely stop here again the next time we pass through!
I love the food. Especially the fried mozzarella and the dessert menu. Entrees are okay. I think some of the tables are too small though

An absolute gem. The seitan wings are bananas good. The cocktails are delicious. I highly suggest their mac and cheese but you could literally close your eyes and point to an item on the menu and be delighted.

I've eaten here many times. It's kind of the gold standard for vegan restaurants. Even though I almost always get the buffalo Mac and cheese, I love that their menu changes regularly. Chickpea Parmesan is another favorite. The vibe is great if dining in, but I tend to get it to go more often.

It was good food but the service was lack luster for the amount you end up paying for the food. Some would make the argument that well it's vegan it's going to be expensive I just didn't find the value in it.
Got the fried oyster mushrooms and brussel sprouts and it was a gastronomical delight. So satisfying and one of those meals that must be danced in the air between bites because it's so good.
I have had vegan food in over 30 states, and Modern Love is one of the best I have had. Their sandwiches are excellent.
I had shrooms and grits.  It was so good, plus gave me ideas on how to improve my grits at home. Thanks for inspiring me.
No meat here

Wonderful experience! My mother and I went here for a fun girls day brunch, the server, Sam, was very nice and made sure we got our food fast because we were on a schedule, great service, amazing atmosphere, and amazing people working there, THANKS SAM YOU’RE THE BEST ✨
Sooooo good! And the place is super pink and cute 💖💖
I've loved everything I've eaten or drank here. Every time!
After being told that it was ready it wasn't I waited an extra 40 minutes

My third visit and my second carryout order.  I cannot say enough positive things about the food and service.  We preordered a Thanksgiving Feast and we were not disappointed with the quality.  Just one word of warning.  Be careful with the amount you eat.  I'm discovering vegan food is unexpectedly heavy.  What would seem normal portions are actually more than enough.  I recommend you eat 1/2 of what you receive and save the rest for the next day.  This restaurant is a worthwhile family outing, or an intimate couple rendezvous.
Impressive vegan spot in steak town  Omaha!
Absolutely great vegan restaurant with LOTS of options. The Reuben (from siepan and beet) was outstanding and everyone raved about their chosen dishes.

Bright capacious premises. Colour scheme was incongruous for a vegan restaurant or any restaurant  more  nightclub. Staff make everything they  do seem like an imposition. The varied menu offered great promise but the execution was poor . Food was  far too heavily flavoured, over-salted and hard to finish. Did the chef taste  what's put on the plates? Placed an order online and drove 30 minutes to pick it up to find out the order had been canceled and money refunded since they were lunch items vs. brunch. Please fix the site so it doesn't allow you to order something that isn't available.  Staff didn't seem bothered that I was upset by it.  Placed a new order and waited for it there. Jaw-droppingly delicious.  Absolutely lives up to the reputation, even WOWing the skeptical meat eaters.  There is excellent variety in the menu so there's something to appeal to everyone and every mood.  Gorgeous decor with a really lovely atmosphere.  A teensy bit on the pricier side BUT portions are extremely generous and so, so tasty.  Highly recommend and is definitely my favorite restaurant in Omaha.

100% vegan 90% scratch-made Great atmosphere very chill and mellow. The vegan food is great and they have amazing vegan  shakes and ice cream. Would recommend to anyone vegan, vegetarian, or anyone just curious about vegan food and desserts.

Nice Vegan fare. Straightforward dining experience. Can hold a pleasant conversation while enjoying the Chicken fried oyster mushrooms or a vegan Reuben sandwich. The cashewnut ice-cream was wonderful.
The food was great tasting.  The pumpkin praline cheesecake was divine.  Oh and I'm not one to enjoy nachos, but they were fantastic!  Do stop here to eat.

After over five days of searching through online restaurant recommendations, I was fortunate enough to stumble across Modern Love. I walked the 45 minutes from my hotel and eagerly joined the small gathering of brunch goers waiting for the restaurant to open.

What I liked:
- My first impressions of the venue were very good. Though from the outside it appeared to be small, Modern Love was spacious inside with many seating options from chairs to booths
- The waitress came and offered me a menu right away
- The meal was phenomenal and pure perfection! It was only salad, and yet, it seemed like so much more. Never have I had anything like it and I doubt I will again. The salad was huge to the point that I was a bit overwhelmed when I first saw it. The lettuce was crisp, the croutons were very flavourful, the tofu was moist, the dressing was creamy and slightly tangy. The other toppings complemented the salad perfectly
-The waitress was new, but showed great initiative by offering to ask for clarification from her colleague when she was uncertain of an answer
- Prices were very reasonable
- Washroom was clean
- Parking available out front

What could be improved:
- It took quite awhile for my food to be served. At least 30 minutes, not including the 10 minutes leading up to my order being taken. I was in no hurry so it wasn’t a problem for me but I can imagine that if I was on a fixed 1 hour lunch break, this would have been concerning
- At no point did anyone asked me if I had enjoyed my meal, which was really unfortunate because I absolutely loved my meal
- I was still holding my fork and had probably just swallowed my last bite when the waitress came over and asked if I wanted the bill. Asking if I wanted dessert, which I did, was an afterthought for her. I am not certain if this is how things are done in Omaha though, as this was the second time this happened in the past week.
- There was a dueling music battle going on in the restaurant and it was unpleasant. First there was the restaurant's main speakers and then there was the blaring music from the kitchen. At one point the main speakers were turned off and all I could hear was the kitchen music
- I probably would have ordered soup, but it wasn’t ready. Seeing as how the restaurant opened at 11:30am, they should have started setting up earlier so that it would be part way ready to go by opening
- Not all dessert options are listed on the menu

My meal at Modern Love was by far the best meal I had while visiting Omaha, and I can imagine that if I lived in Omaha I would become a regular.
Service is great. Food is healthy and very delicious.
Vegan Food Done Right.  A+
One of the best places in Omaha

Very good vegan food. I especially recommend the nachos. The cashew cheese sauce is great!
I don’t recommend the “chicken” tofu sandwich. It was bland.

We recently went to Modern Love this past weekend with one of our friends who was visiting from CA, this was our first time trying Modern Love.
We were greeted right as we entered, the staff was super friendly but things started going downhill when we got to our table.

him a good time while he was in town and seeing this little bug was the first red flag. I didn’t care too much about it, we were still having a good time but it was concerning. I informed our server of the bug I just killed with the cloth they provided & requested a new one. She apologized for the issue and provided a new cloth, again it wasn’t that big of a deal.

Our friend ordered some appetizers
When it was time to pay, we realized we were charged for the wings we never received. We mentioned this issue to our server, she removed those off our orders. This was red flag number 2

However, the food was sooo good.
Highly recommend getting Roasted Garlic Alfredo with Grilled Portobello

We weren’t too upset about our experience but the service was meh.

I probably wouldn’t come back and dine in for a while.
I am bit bummed out about our first experience because I did want to come back and bring my partner for date night but after what we experienced on  Friday. I’m only doing takeout.
Overall the food is fire AF.

My family and I stopped in on short notice for dinner. We were pleasantly surprised since vegan cuisine is not our regular go-to for meals. We enjoyed the cauliflower, the "burger", and "chicken" sandwich immensely. The vibe of the restaurant was perfect for our evening out too. We were able to enjoy each other's company in a relaxed environment while enjoy our meals. A friend who joined us who is vegan thoroughly enjoyed her meal as well saying it was top notch!
I've been coming to Modern Love for years because of the delicious vegan options.  They are always on top of their food. Love having vegan options in Omaha
Being a midwesterner, I am continually surprised by how delicious vegan food can be. If only I could grill tofu as well as them, I'd go vegetarian as well.

Fantastic vegan food! Been going here for years, love the chicken bacon ranch sandwich, wings, desserts! Can’t really go wrong with anything on the menu! Thanks for being here for us vegans
Best Vegan Food I've ever had, and among the best food I've had anywhere.  Vegan Fine ish dining at its finest.
Very cool place with awesome food! The buffalo cauliflower in and of itself is worth coming back for.

One of the best vegan restaurants I’ve ever been too. My wife is Gluten Free and Dairy Free, while I am not, and there is something for everyone on the menu. Don’t let the “vegan nature” of this restaurant scare you from trying something. The Chik’n Bacon Ranch sandwich was delicious, and the nachos were really good (brunch menu).

I expected a little more flavor with the French toast. The other two enjoyed their food. I am not vegan so that is probably why I was not terribly impressed. But at least I tried it. The staff was wonderful and the interior beautiful.

The customer service here is outstanding. I emailed with a question regarding ingredients and didn’t really expect an answer, but I received a prompt, detailed and kind answer. I called once and wasn’t able to reach anyone and they called me back! All other interactions service wise have been wonderful too. This is such a rarity! 15/10 on customer service and outstanding food too!!! Highly recommend.
Wonderful inviting atmosphere. Great service, amazing food and drinks!

I am not a vegan and generally the people I take to Modern Love are not either. We always find something amazing. They also have gluten free dishes. The whiskey chocolate shake is to die for.

Review update as of Sept 2023:

This place used to have phenomenal food and service. Two years ago I met my girlfriend here for a first date and we used to be regulars. My girlfriend is vegan and I am vegetarian, so we are familiar with the way good vegan should taste. This place still has a special place in our hearts, but the food quality has gone down considerably. Last night we got two appetizers and two entrees. The mozzarella bites tasted like some sort of foodscience experiment and the marinara was very acidic. My girlfriend got the Reuben Sandwich and three bites in said "This is really not good." The sandwich had a hodgepodge of ingredients that didn't go together, and was very dry, very little to no dressing. The bread was mushy too. I got the garlic Alfredo and soldiered through it but the pasta was blatantly overcooked, the Alfredo was done very poorly, and I'm not even convinced there was basil in the pesto. Additionally, the whole dish was served on a bed of fresh arugula and spring mix, which meant the hot pasta and sauce wilted the greens and forced you to have bites that were a mix of bad Alfredo and pseudo-wilted salad greens. The toast was super dry and the grilled portabella mushroom was genuinely burnt beyond recognition. The mushroom was so black and charred, I couldn't even tell it was a mushroom and the flecks of burned mushroom permeated into the entire dish, making it taste like a mess of cashew cream, old spring mix, and grill trap gunk.

That being said, they still nail all the dessert items and the strawberry milkshake was phenomenal. Otherwise it's not worth going unless you're there for just cheesecake and a cocktail.

This place used to be amazing and I'd take my non-vegan friends to show them how great a full-vegan restaurant could be. After last night, I'm embarrassed I paid over $110 for this meal and super disappointed with it.

I realize this is a scathing review, and that is not usually my MO; however, it was so bad I don't think I'll be going back. My best guess is that they hired all-new, ill-trained kitchen staff and the old chef left and was replaced with someone who lied to the owner and promised they could make everything the old chef made (they can't). I say this because the menu items were objectively not well thought-out and the food was not cooked well, so a double whammy there in terms of overall suck.

If you want to go here, just get a cocktail and a cheesecake and spare yourself the waste. Hopefully the quality improves.

I’m not at all a vegan… walked into this place, not knowing it was vegan only…I was amazingly surprised by the brussels sprouts appetizer and the Alfredo dish. The food was amazing. Highly recommend. Pic included but should have not eaten it first. Lol.
Only complaint would be that the TVs are never on.
Awesome food but not always great value.

Incredible vegan culinary experience! Such a great hand crafted vegan menu!! Super friendly staff, and great atmosphere to enjoy healthy and delicious vegan fair. Because everything is whole foods and not just substitutes, it does take a bit to get your food, but it is worth the wait. We look forward to coming back and trying more!
Super cool spot. Delicious food and one of the only all-vegan restaurants in Omaha. I would recommend to everyone for a fantastic meal.
Best vegan food in the midwest
My favorite vegan place in town! Creative dishes, excellent flavor, helpful staff. Be sure to mention any nut allergies - they were so careful!!
Dined in today spontaneously. Amazing service from Sam and food was delicious. Highly recommend shakes and everything was vegan!!! Thank you sam for the great recommendations!

Absolutely love this place. Started going when they were in their tiny place by oleavers but now they have a bigger spot to cater to their following. Just tried the spinach and feta pastry and it was to die for 10/10 recommend!

I really hate leaving a non 5-star review on a vegan restaurant but we found the food to be extremely bland. I had heard so many amazing things and ordered all the food that was highly recommended. But we were really quite disappointed with the lack of flavor. I would absolutely give it another shot when back in Omaha!
Very good.
One of our favorite restaurants in Omaha. We have had most of the dishes on the menu all excellent. The tofu grilled is extra flavorful and the "bacon" is really good too.
Love this place!! Best vegan food in all of Nebraska!
Liam and Haley are probably the most unprofessional servers I’ve ever seen, was enjoying my food for them to be treating others terrible. Undeserving of their position. Made my food taste terrible.
10/10 would highly recommend! The cauliflower buffalo wings are delicious! Every single dish I’ve tried has been great aswell!

This is a restaurant where you might not notice that it’s also vegan. This is the type of restaurant all vegan restaurants should strive to be. This is the gold standard, this is what 10/10 looks like.

I've loved Modern Love even before I was vegan. It's one of my favorite places to indulge for good vegan  food!
I've never had a complaint, I just want to give some feedback :)

We have also enjoyed their Turkiclub sandwiches (which may have been limited time), but another staple item that has departed is their breakfast crunch wrap. The crunch wrap left a few months back, as well, or perhaps earlier this year, but we had been ordering it on weekends pretty regularly last fall. My partner asked while picking up an order recently about if the crunch wrap would be coming back, and was told by a staff member it was a very temporary item and made it sound like it wasn't on the menu for more than a short time which definitely was not our personal experience. Our area does not have a great deal of vegan breakfast variety, so we were sad to see a breakfast favorite leave.
We aren't too heartbroken, as we know ML has regularly updated or cycled their menu, but with these menu items gone with seemingly no return any time soon, the times we would have gone to order from ML has reduced quite significantly.

Super overpriced and quality is going downhill. I’ve eaten in where we were completely forgotten about for over an hour and our food was either burnt, cold, or missing altogether when it finally came out. I’ve also had it delivered where they didn’t include about $20 worth of items and didn’t bother refunding even though they said they would.

This is a restaurant where you might not notice that it’s also vegan. This is the type of restaurant all vegan restaurants should strive to be. This is the gold standard, this is what 10/10 looks like.

The only ‘area for improvement’ we encountered is that for Sunday brunch, you can’t order any appetizers until the last hour of them being open, from 2-3pm. At that point, why even have these items on the Sunday brunch menu if they are only offered right before close? You also can’t order desserts, even to-go during this time. So while would think twice about coming for Sunday brunch (get the grits), I would recommend any other time.

My first time eating at Modern Love and it was fantastic. It had been on my list for a long time (even before moving to Omaha) and I’m so glad I did. Had the Seitan Beet Rueben sandwich, which was fantastic. Really nice texture and flavor. The side I chose was the potato salad, which is definitely one of the best I’ve had. I was also able to taste the Chickpea Cutlet Parmesan, which was incredible! Very generous portions of food so you won’t be leaving hungry. I look forward to coming back for dinner soon and trying other items on the menu because I saw many others that looked really good. Trust the reviews - this place is the real deal!
One of my wife and I's go-to places for date night. Also they take eco stuff pretty seriously. Lots of recycling and composting going on. Plus take-out wares are compostable.
A place with a unique flavor of food. Definitely recommend it.

The only regret here is that we don’t live in Omaha. Best vegan food we’ve had outside of the coast(s). Seriously. Don’t skip the oyster mushroom calamari or any salad (even the lettuce is amazing). Stop reading already and just go. It’s worth it.

We stopped here with our two little doggies and our bunny, they hung out on the lovely lawn while we waited for our super delicious carry out! A must for cross county road tripping vegans! This place is your Midwest oasis!!! Best kale salad and the most luscious grilled tofu ever! Husbear loved his burger and fries!!!

LOVED this restaurant!!! I am still talking about it weeks later after finding this gem on a work trip. Vegan menu is full of immense creativity and executed with a lot of flavor. I like how they offer house made protein options VS fake processed meats/dairy that so many vegan places do. Allergen conscious menu. Atmosphere is lovely and comfortable. Service was on point and helpful. I had the reuben with salad option and potato salad. Reuben was amazing and huge. Salad was super fresh and had a lovely tahini dressing. One of the best meals I have eaten. I was appreciative to get nourishing, healthy, and delicious food while on a work trip.
Amazing vegan food. A must stop if you're in Omaha! Even non-vegan eaters enjoyed the food. Lovely atmosphere, great place for a date night.

I ordered two mac & shews bowls and they cost $50. Look at the amount like how stingy could you be in the portioning. Literally took 8 bites and it was gone. Not to mention the wait time was over an hour. The wait time i’ll get over since I’m patient but the food portioning and price? Absolutely not.
The food is absolutely incredible! One the best vegan restaurant I’ve tried ✨

If you’re looking for vegan food in Omaha, this place is a gem! I thoroughly enjoyed everything that we ate at our table. Being GF/DF it was such a blessing to be able to go into a restaurant and have so many different options to choose from. The menu is diverse. Will definitely be back again!

Being a vegan this is my all time favorite restaurant in Omaha. Food is fantastic and the menu changes, so you have different options. Try the shakes they are sweet and decadent. The fried chicken tastes so close to the real thing 10/10
I'm not vegan or vegetarian. The food was delicious. The food combinations were wonderfully unique. I suggest making a reservation.

I visited Modern Love twice while I was visiting Nebraska. First, I had their Chick’n Bacon Ranch & it was filled with so much flavor! So delicious. Then, I had their Buffalo Mac & Chews - equally as delicious, if not better. The atmosphere of the restaurant is inviting & fun! I was so tempted to get a boozy milkshake lol maybe next time!
This was some of the best food I’ve ever had! I can’t wait to come back. Great drinks, atmosphere, and friendly staff.

Have visited a handful of times now, & the food is pretty amazing! I am a meat eater but love trying different things and this place does amazing job at making things taste like meat!
The wait staff & bartenders are nice but this is where I think this place is lacking. Most wait staff are lacking in the basics. I usually only see my waiter when I order and when we get the check. Don't usually get refills or just checking on how we're doing mid meal.
Most staff I've had aren't very knowledgeable on the menu nor very passionate on the food. I don't get a whole lot of excitement.
But anyways just my feedback. None of this are deal breakers as I still plan to frequently visit because the food is that good!
Such an amazing Vegan spot!! I wish I lived closer so I could go more often. Service was pleasant, drinks and food were an explosion of flavor and texture!!
Some of the best vegan food I have had ever. I got the seitan beet Reuben and it was delicious! Great fries. I ordered the spiked butterfly lemonade, then I ordered another.
This place was so amazing and delicious I will definitely come back over and over again
Food was okay, lacking seasoning. First place I know that charged for hit sauce.
Burger was great. Kale ceasar salad was good. Had to return original because of wilted, turned lettuce. Tofu chicken add to salad was a bit dry. Recommend this place!

We ended up taking most of it home for the friend who couldn't make the dine-in experience with us. 😬 We'd like to go again, but we will definitely be caing first. I had driven in from Texas to visit my friend, and this was a special meal, being both of our 40th birthdays. Bummed, but it happens.
Amazing vegan desserts! I will likely come back to this place when I'm in town again.
Very trendy, vibrant restaurant with really great vegetarian and vegan options.
Food feels like it tastes better every time I go.
Delicious!!
Great food, and excellent service.

Very poor service. Before leaving, we asked the server for a box because we did not eat over 50% of our meal. We walked out of the restaurant and accidentally forgot the box so immediately returned only to be informed our server had put our takeaway box in the trash. Unsure what the logic was with this? No apology was provided and the restaurant did not compensate for their error. If you make a mistake that’s acceptable but when you don’t own up to it and rectify the error it’s unacceptable and results in lost business. We won’t be returning or recommending this restaurant to others.
Head chef really made my experience pleasant and the staff makes you feel like it’s home! The food too best vegan spot in town…
Always delicious

BEST VEGAN RESTAURANT EVER!!! It’s SO good, every time someone visits me I take them here. The food is outstanding, I loveee the chicken sandwich. The fries are delicious, and the shakes are amazing if you have room for desert! They have great tea, coffee, and cocktails too. I’ve never had a bad meal here.

Everyone's been raving about this restaurant and as much as I love meat I did not miss it in the mac and cheese meal. I think there was like a breaded fried tofu. At least that's what it looked like but it tasted amazing. I will definitely be eating there again.

So Google asked me to update my post. I have since had the eggplant parmesan and it was great. I also had a vanilla shake and enjoyed it too.

Extremely impressed with this vegan restaurant. The seitan wings were exceptional without trying too hard to be "chicken". I also got the fried mushroom entree and was impressed. The shakes are extremely rich.

Last night, my bestie and I came in to celebrate her birthday dinner.  We had a such fantastic experience with it being her first time. We had a really great start to the dinner with some Firecracker Broccoli and Fried Mozzarella. The Firecracker Broccoli was fantastic and super crispy and crunchy in all the right ways with just enough spice to flavor not burn you out. However  all of the flavors on the plate balanced nicely. The Fried Mozzarella balls, will replace any idea of what vegan cheese in your mind is with this forever. Creamy and smooth but encased in the most delicious crunchy goodness that has never tasted better than these. They’re so good you’ll forget they are even vegan and with the perfect marinara to balance their richness.

For entrees, I had the Roasted Garlic Alfredo with a Chickpea Cutlet and she had the Chickpea Cutlet Parmesan. All I can recommend over and over again is the Chickpea Cutlet will totally make you happy in so many ways. It’s chewy, crispy and smooth all in the same bite when mixed the Roasted Garlic Alfredo and Pesto and the Pepita Parmesan was a fun texture twist. All of the perfect textures combine with the most amazing of flavors so good you’ll become pressed to want to think about things any other way. My second favorite thing we ordered had to be the 𝗚𝗮𝗿𝗹𝗶𝗰 𝗣𝗮𝗿𝗺𝗲𝘀𝗮𝗻 𝗕𝗿𝘂𝘀𝘀𝗲𝗹𝘀. Again… NOT REAL PARMESAN?! HOW?! It was the creamiest, most delicious garlicky “cheese” sauce, and it perfect complimented the Brussel sprouts. As someone who puts grated Parmesan on her veggies almost every night, I’M SHOCKED I couldn’t taste a difference. I would drink that sauce with a straw.

We also ordered the 𝗡𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗼 𝗠𝗮𝗰 & 𝗦𝗵𝗿𝗲𝘄 which had cashew cheddar mac sauce, walnut chorizo, pico, avocado, pickled jalapeños, and cilantro. Again the “cheese” was unbelievable. And the walnut “chorizo” tasted JUST like the real thing. I really want to try the classic mac next time!

We also got a 𝗞𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗖𝗮𝗲𝘀𝗮𝗿 𝗦𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗱 that was one of the most beautiful plated salads I’ve ever been served. Peep the mini salt and pepper shakers in that pic. So cute!
