Lovely vegan restaurant! Wonderful friendly employees and the food was amazing!
So good! As a vegan, I loved it, but so did my nonvegan friends. Thank you for being a bright spot on Omaha!
Love the new space! Feels very open and the windows, bar & decor add to a very classy but comfortable feel. Food continues to be fabulous ❤️

Modern love really surprised me! It’s vegan dining with a modern twist. The poutine is the best poutine I’ve ever had, much better than poutines with meat. I love it when I can go to a restaurant and order ANYTHING I want, since I eat a plant-based diet. The entree was a spicy curry, which was delicious. Great wine and lovely staff. This is the place we go for special occasions and it has never disappointed me. The new location is wonderful! Setting was nice too. Recommend to make a reservation.
Only vegan restaurant in Omaha. A bit pricey for the avg person, but  good food with decent portions.
Mordern Love is one of my most favorite vegan restaurant! It is an all vegan restaurant and the food is absolutely delicious!!
Fantastic place and food
Great service, great food, great vibe!
Best food I have ever eaten. Huge portions of vegan comfort food. Outta this world, the flavors are unlike anything I've ever tasted. Cant wait to keep going back again and again and again
So amazing we drive an hour to eat here! My meat eater husband loves it too!
Wonderful vegan experience
Excellent vegan food.  Mushroom bourginoin was excellent, and I am not vegetarian.
I felt like like the food was bland - under seasoned. It didn't have enough flavor for me. I will not be back there.
Eat here often.

I didn’t know I was headed to a vegan restaurant, and I left with a new midtown favorite. I’m not a vegetarian or vegan, and I loved everything that I tried. I didn’t miss the meat or dairy at all. We ordered 4 different appetizers, and they were all great, especially the Brussels sprouts. I had the Mushroom Bourguignon, and it was great. Good beer selection too. I’ll definitely be back when I’m in town again.
Excellent food.

It was ok. We were seated promptly,  but the tables are tiny and cramped together so we could hear everyone's conversations around us. We're not vegan, but we do regularly eat vegan meals, so have some experience. I am sensitive to spicy things, so I asked the waitress if there was *any* kick at all for a few things on the menu that looked good, and weren't already rated with a spicy symbol. After reassurance from the waitress the was *no* spicy-ness, I got Mac and Cashews. It was so fiery, I could only eat a few bites. So I switched meals with my dining companion who had ordered the Chickpea Parmesean Cutlets, though I could eat it,  it didn't stand out as spectacular. We shared a raspberry cheesecake for dessert (that was excellent). Overall,  our waitress was inattentive and slow and the food was priced much higher than reasonable (a milkshake was $8). It was fine, but will not go out of our way to go again.

One of my favorite places to eat in Omaha. Don't let the vegan fare turn you off, the food is amazing in its own right.

The Mac & Shews is a good starting place for those who are a bit pickier, but I would recommend the Root Vegetable Coconut Curry for those looking to try something new.

The desserts are fantastic and I always recommend trying a signature cocktail for date night.
The best part of my trip to Omaha. Everything we had was delicous- strongly recommend the boozy milkshakes!
This was magical!!!!!!
Such a cool place! A must-try!
Bomb

It was an experience. I’m not a vegan or vegetarian but felt the menu had plenty of options that were appealing. It would not be a go to place for us on the regular but gives us an option when my sister and her husband come in who are vegans !

I've been to the new location at midtown crossing several times. I've had so many bad experiences that I do not plan to return. The food is overpriced and not worth the hype and servers are snotty and aloof.

Phenomenal Vegan food. Anyone would like it. Prices are definitely high. But I can't argue too much because the way it was presented to you was art in my opinion. Very satisfying food. Everyone was really nice to me there.
Went there for a team dinner. The food was delicious and it's truly an art to create delicious vegan equivalents of some.of my favorite foods.
Our first (and unfortunately only) vegan experience in Omaha.  Great food each time we have visited. We have taken non vegans here and they also loved it. This place is special!
Simply amazing!

I feel as if Micah must be a douchebag, and seems to confuse vegans with hipsters in his stereotyping. Vegans come in all forms, they're simply people who believe killing and exploiting sentient beings is wrong. That being said, the place is a bit expensive. I honestly preferred Block 16's vegan block burger over Modern Love's, but they still have a lot of good food, and while I don't think it's the best out there, I'll eat here whenever I'm in town to show support for a vegan only restaurant.
Top of their game with everything they do
So good would recommend to anyone.
My wife didn't inform me it was Vegan, so imagine my embarrassment when I raved over the buffalo wings. So yeah, check it out.

This place generally sucks, every experience I've had has been trash. Expensive food that you don't really get what you ask for vague descriptions and half the time bad service been here about 5 times and I gotta say it's either burned because it's covering up that it already tastes bad, or they have a few good overpriced options that they are out of on the day you decide you want it. The menu is always the same and there isn't any variation or variety to any of it over the years it's only gotten worse and more pretentious and annoying if anything changes.

As the wife and I worked on Valentines this year we decided on a weekend date. We arrived around 7pm and were asked if we had reservations. We did not but still got seated within 2 minutes as they just had another couple leave. The environment in here was relaxing, I myself enjoyed the decor. We ordered La Poutine Moderne for our starter. I thought this was spot on. Good flavor. Wife doesn't like onions as much and there was a good amount but she still enjoyed it as well. She got the Chickpea Bacon Ranch Sandwich and potato salad. She wasn't a fan of the capers in the potato salad but I thought it was a genius way to add some new flavors. I took a bite of her sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. I ordered the Chickpea Cutlet Parmesan. Everything on my plate was delicious too and I had enough for leftovers. Their kombucha on tap was great too. We need more restaurants like this in the area! We ordered the Banana Tiramisu Bundtcake to go for dessert and just had our first bite. Props to our waitress who heard us say a lot of things in our conversation that could have been taken way out of context but was still super friendly. If you want to try some vegan meals away from home Modern Love is where it's at! The only reason I cannot give 5 stars was the wait time on our food.
Everything was absolutely delicious! As a vegan it felt nice not having to worry and customize my entire meal. The service was great! Food tasty! Atmosphere lovely! Will definitely be back.
I'm not vegan but I loved the place.  Outstanding food.  Great service!
The most amazing food hands down.
Not a vegan, but the atmosphere was nice, staff was friendly & the food was likeable, better than I feared.
I finally made it to this wonderful restaurant. Everything we had was great and I’m not vegan or vegetarian. Highly recommend that everyone try it out!!
So tasty, and a great vibe in the new, more open space. It's very gratifying to have access to such a top-notch vegan restaurant!
So, so good.
I love the menu
Good place for an alternative meal, prices are fair enough and staff is courteous,  make a reservation if going fri or sat night
Our meal was fantastic! Great service! Great atmosphere!
Great food. Portobello was exquisite. Tables are a little cramped.
I've never had such amazing food before, let alone great vegan!  The food they make is prepared perfectly!

So trying vegan eateries as we travel to watch our son play hockey.first time to Omaha. Had high Hope's for modern love but was not impressed. Had a cheese burger and wanted my side of fries omitted and a order of poutine. Not possible. The burger was heavy and dry . The bread was same. They can take a lesson or two from meat on main or heart choices. On the plus side the milkshake was delicious.

Perhaps the best vegan restaurant in the country (or world maybe?). I don't know for sure, as I've not tried every one out there. However, this place WILL NOT DISAPPOINT. I promise! Go! Now!

Service, atmosphere, presentation, variety, flavor, quality, and everything else was darn near perfect. Modern Love is an all around A+ experience.

Oh man.  Very indulgent and delicious vegan stuff. Recommend the nachos -- amazing value, delicious walnut meat.

Only nitpick is the wine pours. Teensy. You're better off getting a beer.

The atmosphere is relaxing and the staff are friendly. The food is high-quality and filling. The dessert is DELICIOUS! Great vegan restaurant. My only request would be to have access to nutrition labels or calorie numbers for each item.

Great little Omaha gem. Good for vegans and meat-eaters alike. Cauliflower hot wings you're amazing for man who likes flavor and chicken wings..... I will go out of my way for these again and again.
The staff was very pleasant and helpful felt at home making food decisions with them assisting.
The menu had a great variety of styles and types of foods. Each full of flavors that will bring you back again and again.
My daughter and I love this place and so do our friends who frequents the old and now the new restaurant.

Food was really good we ordered the bqq seitan wings which were incredible!! Spicy and tangy! The cutlet was also really tasty and really filling. The price point and the cookies and cream cheese cake is where I took a star for. There are so many Amazing vegan desserts and that was not one of their best. Will definitely try other things on the menu though

We arrived later in the evening traveling back to Chicago.  We wanted something healthy and tasty.  We ordered the curry and the burger.  I arrived at the restaurant to pick up our order and was greeted by incredible staff.  It sounded like they got along.  The burger and fries were impeccable.  I wish the restaurant was in Chicago as I would go back again.  The curry had a great flavor too.
A vegan restaurant everyone can love! The food is delicious and inventive, and the atmosphere is always chill.
Best vegan spot in town

First time here and it was GREAT.  I was a little skeptical based on reviews of the new location over the old but glad we went anyway.  Had the nachos to start, meatloaf for meal and finished with cookies and cream cheesecake and cocktails, too.  We had to try it all as a first vegan restaurant experience (and definitely carnivores).  Ticket for 2 cocktails, app, 2 entrees and split dessert with tip was just $100.  A little pricey but good for a special night out.

FOOD IS FABULOUS!!!  Service was good, too.  Only thing is those tables are so darn small, but the server kept it clear and manageable.

Will be back again!

I enjoyed the restaurant . Food was good, and had plenty of taste. Didnt enjoy the textures of the fake meat and cheese. Was worth the try and I was pleased with our visit. Probably won’t be back tho, vegan food isn’t my thing , but I can’t give anyone a reason not to try the restaurant. Cocktails were very good!
I had the vegan version of a burrito bowl, tasted good.
Amazing food and a nice atmosphere.
Exceptional food and service. Recommend to everyone of every walk of life.
This place is great. Is funky without being pretentious and the food is delicious. Highly recommend.

I'm not a vegan. Not even remotely. This is a great restaurant. The things they can do with vegetables is astounding. An associate of mine ordered the Mac n chews (Mac and cheese) where the cheese is made from cashews. It was brilliant. You would not have known it wasn't Mac and cheese. Great flavors in everything I tried. Friendly service. Knowledgeable service. Vegan. For sure vegan. Even the dessert. Vegan. Themes right. Doesn't matter you will enjoy the service. atmosphere and most of all the great food. Go give it a try if you haven't.

I have been to many vegan restaurants in the midwest and Modern Love is by far my favorite! Vegan or not, all will love this place. The food & cocktails are always amazing and switched up for according seasons. The atmosphere and staff are incredibly inviting. The new location is gorgeous. No wonder it is always packed. Get a reservation!
It was basically junk food, but good for you!
Chose this spot as a stop between Chicago and Colorado.. great decision! Amazing food. Definitely go for the buffalo cauliflower wings!

I discovered PPK many years ago and love Isa’s recipes and techniques, so I’ve been wanting to go here since it opened. Finally, we decided to take a little road trip from Chicago for NYE. We wanted to try as much as possible, so we ordered the pix fixe and a couple other items from the regular menu. Everything was incredible and in perfect portions. Lobster mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, bacon wrapped dates, black eyed pea crab cakes... OMG!
The service is top notch, the atmosphere is fun, the music is great, and those velvety bar stools are so cozy. Of course we stayed for an after dinner drink because we didn’t want to leave, but also saw some cocktails that needed to be had. I can’t wait to go back! Thank you Isa and crew!
Delicious vegan food.

Love the Midtown location. I ventured there with my son inside two of my favourite people! The waitstaff here is absolutely amazing. In the food well he hands down the best. If you are looking for amazing vegetarian and vegan selections this is your restaurant.
Loved it! I'm not vegetarian but I'd still recommend going here. Had the curry with tofu. Originally I didn't order tofu but it came out with it, I tried it, and it absolutely made the dish.
Best food ever. Way better than nearly anything in Glasgow, Scotland - vegan capital of Europe.
AMAZING food and excellent service. Great for vegans and everyone else!
Good weekly specials at Omaha’s all-vegan restaurant.
Amazing Food!

Wow!  The food was delicious but the service was even better. I will ensure that I visit every time I am in town. A must stop for lovers of all food types - but YES it’s all vegan.  Tonight was my second time here and it did not disappoint, I had a blacked tofu Alfredo and the  Snickers pie (to go). I have also had the burrito bowl - this might be my favorite.
The best restaurant. Beautiful space and look at this pecan lentil meatloaf. The chickpea cutlet Parm was also perfection. Another impressive experience!
Best food ever!  Service was awesome too, highly recommend, you need not be a vegetarian to enjoy the food, a must try place!

I love modern love's food. Their customer service is always great as well. I only wish they were open more hours, but I understand they have to do what's best for their business. The price is on the higher end a bit, can't eat there everyday. However, if I could I would eat there everyday. The best vegan restaurant to go to in Omaha hands down.

I'm not a vegan.
I think the delivery of the food was good though not everything hit a 5 star for me (details below). However I feel like it's harder to do vegan foods which is why I did give them a 5.

Hits:
Definitely go for the fried mozzarella which is actually a cashew fauxmage.
The Walnut chorizo on the nachos were fantastic.
Warm Apple tart: this was about a 4 for me

Half Misses?: These weren't terrible, but more average and I think there might be better things to order
Seitan brisket: there was an overly watery portion of my dish which made the dish not fantastic. The over fried part of the brisket was noticeable. they weren't really emulating beef... It was much more like pork and I don't know how I felt about that.

they serve tea from the tea Smith

Great comfort food. Only vegan restaurant in Omaha
Inventive  vegan food that is  delicious and healthy
Very good food, would recommend restaurant
Impeccable cuisine, per usual. new location is beautiful. :)
100% vegan restaurant. Food is amazing & staff super friendly

As a carnivore who took my vegan wife here the food is good.  The chickpea parmesean was great, the crust on the cutlet is pretty amazing.  It reminded me more of a chicken fried cutlet but it works well.  The cheese fries were also great.

Fantastic! The other reviews probably cover anything that I can say, but this place is wonderful. The staff are friendly, service is prompt, and the food is out of this world. I recommend if you are a vegan or not, you will not be disappointed.

This was my first time here and being a carnivore I was very impressed!! We had the buffalo wings for a appetizer, which were amazing!!! For dinner we had a pizza burger and chickpea cutlets with fettuccine. Both were very good!! I will be back to try a few more things that’s for sure!!
I dont eat vegan but this place is amazing. The food is so good.
ADORE their new space. really brings the feel of modern love and their food to the atmosphere. I've loved every item I've tried. service has been great every time I've gone. decent prices too

This food was so delicious! It was truly and experience and just crazy that its vegan.
A little pricey, but worth the experience. Drinks were good and service was great!
This place has amazing food and staff. The owner is down to earth and if you are serious about what you put into your body and you love an artisan fare, this place is for you and yours!
Refreshing to have amazing vegan option in a town made of beef. They do an amazing job. I could not believe the deserts were vegan!
I've been here three times now,  different selections each time.  I'm never disappointed. Generous portions,  quality ingredients,  delicious!

I went to the old location a couple if times since it originally opened. Now I've been to the new one three times already.  The food is great, I love it all.  There space is fun, comfortable and inviting.  I've changed to a strictly plant based diet and ML is a great reward.

Good to great food.  Decent to great service.  The new building is much better than the old one.  Far more quiet too, so you can have a conversation which was impossible before the move.  I wish that I could give this restaurant 5 stars but the best dish (Mac and shews) is just too inconsistent from season to season.
Great gem in Omaha. The new building is much bigger and really nice. The food is amazing (try the schnitzel and the Brussels Aioli). I love that Omaha has an amazing vegan restaurant...
Great food. Great vibe. Friendly staff. Accommodating to and careful with allergies.
Ordered the chickpea bacon ranch which had great flavor and crunch. Loved it. With the trip!

Food is good, wish they marinated the tofu for the Mac and shews. Some of the portions are far too expensive for what you get. Five cauliflower wings for $12 seems steep especially when you leave as hungry as ya come in.
round two was worst
the burger is edible but the special sauce is disgusting, got a salad on the side and pretty sure that they use the special sauce on it which rendered it inedible (wish i woulda got the fries instead or the potato salad because it was disgusting)
Shakes are fairly decent, the matcha mint with caramel is weird regret spending the $8 on it
some of the staff is still incredibly rude some of them are extremely kind
honestly the place is worth it if ur a vegan not wanting to cook junky food at home but it'd probably be tastier if u did

This place is definitely top 5 of all vegan places I have tried since venturing out in the last year. I would recommend making reservations. We waited about 15 minutes on Friday night around 7:00 PM for a party of two. The atmosphere is welcoming and the staff is friendly.

We sampled the Garlic Parmesan Cauliflower Wings, Portobello Steak Salad, and Autumn Chana Masala. The masala was my least favorite of the three. It tasted more like a chili to me and was missing a bit of texture.  The cauliflower left me feeling excited and inspired and the portobello was cooked to perfection.

I am looking forward to sampling more dishes and will provide updates in the future.

My partner and I drove two hours to Modern Love yesterday for our reservations and had a truly upsetting experience.
To begin with we were sat at the smallest table I've ever seen in a restaurant and had to put our waters and water pitcher on the window ledge to fit our menus/plates etcs on the table.
Then it seemed like everyone around us was attended and served first. We were not able to even order our entrees until 45 min.s in.
We rarely saw our server and when we did she rushed through everything she said so we weren't able to ask many questions or talk to her at all.
The food was a little bland considering what it cost but the portions are great. Also the glasses of prosecco are generous.
The quinoa and beans in our tempeh bowl were buried, mushy and had no flavor.
Ans we had many questions throughout the service that we had to get up and find someone to answer because we rarely saw our server.
We were in the restaurant a total of 2 hours and only spent 15 minutes actually eating. For the drive and the amount we paid for the food we are extremely unhappy and will not even consider returning.
THE BEST.
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! The food is always amazing! The nachos and the wings are my favorite things on the menu! It is a place vegans and non-vegans will both fall in love with!
Excellent!
Best place in town to feast on some delicious vegan food!  Try it once and fall in love, you'll be coming back regularly :)
It was worth the drive to Omaha for a restaurant where I can choose anything. The staff was nice. Looking forward to the new location which will hopefully have more space
Nice place and nice people. The food is pretty good but not the best vegetarian I have had

Modern Love is great! Been here many times and almost never fails to be amazing...and when it wasn't amazing, they TOTALLY made up for it with excellent service! I can't wait for the new location to open. I WILL say though, my favorite appetizer was the Brussels with aioli and they've been changed out for Brussels with Chimichurri sauce...not a fan but they weren't terrible either. Anything with the chickpea cutlets is worth a try and the nachos molo are ridiculously good. We have brought numerous non-vegans here and all of them have enjoyed their meals. Can't recommend Modern Love enough!
Cute place, love the food! 👍
Absolutely amazing! Great service and wonderful food!
Love, love, love the food here.  More locations please :)
Mac n shews and bbq cauliflower 😋
Now I have a place I could go out with my Vegan friend. The food is delicious. Love mozzarella balls.
Nice..I liked it a lot. Big size of portions.
Delicious, amazingly prepared food in a clean space with friendly staff. Don't go without a reservation!
As a vegetarian I enjoyed a restaurant where I didn't have to search for food that had not meat. I really like the vibe and the food was delicious. ☺️👍🏻

Amazing vegan food!  We started with the Nachos Molo, and it left us wanting more.  Our main dishes included the Coconut Chana Masala and the Chickpea Bacon Ranch Sandwich, both tasted amazing.  Our drinks complemented well: a Watermelon Margarita and Schilling Beer Company's Pineapple Passionfruit Cider.  And to end this incredible meal we split the Peanut Butter Snickers pie for dessert.  We will be back!
Wonderful atmosphere good service food is very good.
Food was great: fresh and creative.

Not as good as 3 years ago.
Appetizers were tasty but main dishes lacked flavor. Disappointing for the price.
Not sure I'll be back.  Maybe for an appetizer and dessert.  Staff friendly enough and very clean.  Nutritious. Always busy.

Close quarters. Parking tight and not entirely paved, watch for mud puddles. And other drivers. The lot is contiguous with the neighboring bar and they are territorial per the signs posted. It's not easy to park in the neighborhood but could be done if you are halfway fit.

Really creative vegan cooking that will leave you satisfied and wanting to come back again. I had the chickpea parmesean with marinara. Absolutely delicious with a lovely tomato tang. For dessert the snickers pie was decandently delicious with rich chocolate ganache, salted caramel and peanuts. Yum! The rhubarb margarita was refreshing and tart!

Best of the best vegan restaurants! Small in size, small menu however LARGE flavor and no dish will disappoint! I'd recommend the Chicken Parmesan or Chickpea Avacado Ranch sandwich. But like I said, everything is full of flavor. Lets not forget there beers and craft cocktails...again a small selection but something for everyone I believe. Oh....and dont forget dessert!  We are making this a twice a month date night!  Another quick recommendation is to call and get a reservation.

It's amazing what these people are able to do with vegan food. I am not a vegan - I just came with a friend and was impressed by the creativity and taste here. If you can appreciate the food genre and be open-minded, you'll like this place regardless of not being a vegan. GET DESSERT!

Love this restaurant with all my heart. I can have a bad day and after being in this place surrounded by it’s good homie positive energy and delicious foods....I am back to feeling like I’m in some glorious afterlife.

Thank Isa for bringing your talents to Omaha and I cannot wait for the restaurant to relocate to Midtown Crossing! Xoxoxoxo
Best vegan comfort food in the U.S.

It's too small. We just spent all week in Denver and never had to make reservations at any place we stopped. I like the idea of the small menu, but it was hard to decide.  I chose the chickpea parm.  After the wait, it arrived luke warm. Got dessert to go, we'll see how that is.

It's absolutely our favorite restaurant of all time. Not just vegan restaurant, any restaurant. The flavors they have imagined together are at the very least deliciously dreamy. So thankful for this place!

We were traveling through the city and called ahead for takeout. We had the Nachos Molo, the Modern Cheeseburger x2, the Blackberry Nectarine pie and the Peanut Butter Snickers pie. Everything was amazing. The cheeseburgers were VERY large and we could have shared 1 instead. They put the food into compostable containers instead of plastic, a detail I appreciate very much. I wish we lived closer and if we did I would eat here all the time. Very well done!

Good food, service, and atmosphere. Our server had told us that the portions were huge. So we split a side an entree and a dessert. The Buffalo wings were amazing, the stroganoff need a little salt and the ice cream sundae was really tasty. The only problem here is the size of the entree. It was less than huge and less than a portion to share. We enjoyed, but we left a little hungry. I recommend coming to get some vegan food and trying the well made eats. Everything is made in house, which I always like to hear. The less prepackaged food that I can eat the better.
Pricey but worthwhile
All vegan restaurant and food tasted amazing!
One of the best vegan places I have ever been to. The food was great and unlike anything I have ever tried. Their menu was super creative and delicious.

The food was good and the cocktail was nice; however, the seating was terrible! The place was in such a small space you can hear literally everything from the people next to you. And if you are a plus size person it is EXTREMELY uncomfortable.
Really good vegan food!
Overrated

Amazing.

Best vegan food in Omaha hands down! Great locale and fantastic seasonal menu. Try their cashew cheese it's delicious. I hope they expand more places because their restaurant is one of the best in Omaha hands down.
Best Vegan food in Omaha!

The website does not indicate the kitchen closes at 8:30, so this was a waste of time for us and disappointing that we couldn't even get food to go (we already know what we wanted) as we asked about that too. Seitan buffalo wings! Love them!  Have them everytime I go as an appetizer.  Last time I went, also had the buffalo mac & cheese.  Each time I visit it's a wonderful surprise!!!
I'm not vegan, but everything I ate was exceptional good for any restaurant. Trying the nachos was a bit scary, but they turned out to be my favorite dish.
The food there is excellent, I seem to never be able to find any room for their amazing desserts.  The best restaurant in town, just so happens to be vegan as well.  6 stars.
Delicious! Friendly Vegan!?

Grab the food to go and you will be in heaven! However delicious food should not come with horrid customer service. We went out for a girls night with our Bride-to-Be and they literally all but forgot our table!!! (We obviously made a reservation for this event.) Our waitress went to refill our water and literally never brought it back. We ordered an insane amount of food to try everything and were given one glass of water and a set of drinks the whole night. I've never been so disappointed in a restaurant. Grab the food to go. Or go to Barnes and Noble and buy the cookbooks that  the creator of restraunt has published including "Isa Does It" and "Veganomicon."

Incredible! So good! So filling! Modern Love's house patty, sesame seed bun, cashew cheddar, pickles, tomato, red onion, lettuce, and special sauce. Wonderful staff and service. Would highly recommend to anyone!

We ate here tonight and savored every bite! We started with the Buffalo Wings which I'm still astonished weren't made of meat. I had the Curry and my husband had a Mac and Cheese (but not actually cheese) bowl. Both were seasoned perfectly, beautifully plated, and obviously made from the freshest ingredients. The desserts were devine! We had Carrot Cake and the Snicker Pie, which melted in our mouths. Our server was attentive and quick. When you go, be sure to make reservations, and expect a tight fit in the parking lot. The portions are perfect-size but my husband and I discussed how patrons (such as our parents who appreciate the large, starchy portions of an old supper club), might be disappointed by the serving size. but overall, a unique and mouthwatering dining experience!
Delicious vegan comfort food!
My first time eating at a vegan restaurant.  Everything was amazing!

I decided to give this place a shot after hearing so much about it. I highly recommend a reservation, as it was packed on a Thursday night. The restaurant is small and quite loud, but the service was amazing! I had their daily special of fried mushroom, kale slaw, gravy, and a corn muffin with their Elvis pie. The dinner was good, but I don't think vegan is for me. They called it their "KFC" which was too much. The slaw and muffin were quite good. The pie had a graham cracker crust with pb custard, bananas, and a chocolate ganache topping. The flavors were all good, but I felt the chocolate kind of overpowered the others. Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone who is adventurous with their food. I will definitely be back to try another of their meals.
Great service and fantastic food. Do yourself a solid and eat here!

Our family great enjoyed this dining experience!  We were able to get a table quickly although it was a busy Saturday night. Would recommend a reservation on the weekend.  Food, service and atmosphere were A++
When I was pregnant with my second child, this was my go to place. I love their salads! Fresh and flavorful. They have very good cakes too. The staff was warm and always helpful. I just love it here.
Such a lovely place to dine. Make a reservation because even when I come here by myself which is most of the time there is a wait.

I'm not big on the whole vegan lifestyle, that should be apparent with all my BBQ reviews, but this place puts good flavor in there food and the wait staff was awesome, as always my date wasn't half bad and is begging me to go again regardless of the hour & half drive.
Delicious!
Amazing food, has potential to convert everyone to become vegan. I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone! You will not miss meat!

The staff were friendly and courteous. The food was decent, but not great. It's definitely the best vegan food in general that I've had in Omaha, but that's not saying much. I'm super glad it exists, since I got the impression vegan options are a rarity here.
Super

An absolute treat of a vegan diner. The staff was exceptionally friendly, the food was perfectly made and tasted phenomenal. The buffalo wings are worth the trip alone. Would highly reccomend to vegans and non vegans alike.
Amazing food, great prices. Get the Mac.
Loved this place and the waitresses were awesome....
Amazing new menu, loved every item. Gladly will be going back again and again.
Amazing. Make a reservation because they're busy! I have a feeling *everything* on the menu is just as fantastic as it looks.
Great vegan food! Service was just a bit slow.
Vegan loved it. Hope to go back soon.
Great Vegan Place in Omaha!!
Great VEGAN restaurant!  The #1 Vegan dining in Omaha, NE.
excellent place for vegan dining.  slightly more pricey
The food is delicious! OMG seriously so good!

Such a wonderful establishment. Laid back and EVERYTHING you eat will be amazing. If you're picky or think you should have meat for every meal... try it anyway! Try something new, it may surprise you how good it is! You should respect the expertise and skill as it served though
.. because they know what they are doing here! This is flavor and knowledge that you will not regret trying. Cauliflower wings a must try! Will be back as often as I can.
I usually don't write reviews, but I had to with this place. The food was so tasty. The staff was very sweet and I definitely will be coming back again and again.
Very intimate restaurant and fully plant based. Delicious and satisfying food and drinks.
Awesome food
Absolutely the best!!!

I am a carnivore.  But the food at Modern Love is the B.O.M.B.!!  That Brussels Aioli is a blessing in a bowl! The Mac N Shews is PHENOMENAL!  I also had the Poblano Corn Chowder...DYNAMITE!  And the Gyro?!?  I couldn't believe it was not meat!  Seriously, I am coming back.  Modern Love is my new favorite restaurant!!
Absolutely the best food ever! Vegan OR S.A.D.! Iwill return every time I get into the Omaha area. Already planning a trip here to bring the the family and also vist the Omaha zoo.

We ordered a bacon burger and it was really good! It tasted almost like a real burger!
The atmosphere is really cute, and the wait staff is super friendly. The whole restaurant is vegan which is super cool. 10/10 I come here about once a month and I love it.
Amazing vegan food and drinks.

I travel a lot and always seek out vegan restaurants when in a new city. From New York City, to Las Vegas, to Dallas....Modern Love is AMAZING!! We picked up Caesar salads and the dressing is the best we have ever tased. The Cheezburger was to die for and the Gyro was delish!! We are in Omaha for a couple of days and will have to return. ❤️❤️❤️❤️
I have been there many times with my daughter.  She is vegan and I am not.  Every time the food is awesome.  Portions are huge. Think about sharing.   Desserts are to die for.
Awesome food and service! I can find vegan and GF dishes here. The mac’ n chews is great. So is the Schnitzel!  Highly recommend.
It was better than expected. So much flavor, staff are friendly, and it's a great atmosphere.
One of the best vegan restaurants I have ever been to! We drive from Lincoln solely to dine here. Seating is cramped but the food is worth it. Isa, the creator, is a genius!
Delicious, creative vegan treats for the taste buds!
Love this place, great selection and the team here is awesome.

Dined here this past weekend with a group of 11. I decided to try the Bacon Cheeseburger but it only took one bite for me to give it a NOPE! I'm not one to give up on a dish but this was especially gross. As I brought the burger towards my face I started to smell something like a wet sock. After my first bite, I found that the char on the patty made it taste like a dirty rug. The bacon was mushy, which fit right in with the rest of the burger. My wife didn't believe me, but almost puked after giving it a taste. More people in my group gave it a shot and the burger was successful at delivering many frowning faces.

The sprouts app was great and the Gnocchi was tasty. We decided to try the cheese cake, but only 1 out of 11 in our group actually thought it was OK. Everyone else thought it was horrible. I would come here again but I definitely know what to avoid on the menu.
Always a great meal and service.
Love the food.
I'm not vegan, but the food here is amazing and reasonably priced with excellent service.
Fantastic food. I’m not a vegan but I’ll definitely eat here again
My vegan fiancee loved it but it took FOREVER to get our food to go.

Absolutely amazing food! Everything is vegan and scrumptious! I had the Mac and chews and my S.O. had the pot pie. We had the quesadilla for appetizer and it was the best quesadilla we have ever had. We had the gingerbread cheesecake and the modern sundae for dessert. I highly recommend the sundae. <3 I seriously am so sad that we live out of state because when we go back home  in going to miss this place.
Great atmosphere, amazing food! We loved it, huge thanks to the staff for a job very well done.

So according to the reviews this is the best vegan place in Omaha, but that is only because this place is literally the only 100% vegan joint in Omaha. The pasta was hoooorrrrriiibbllleeeee! BUT it’s nothing that had to do with Modern Love, I just learned that I hate that style of pasta. The buffalo wings were great. I think the gyro was pretty good but my wife thought it was horrible. The apple pie bread pudding was amaaaazzziiiinnnngggg! All in all this place wasn’t that great though.
Amazing food!
I got the Mac and cheese type dish and it was very good! The dessert was a bit too sugary for my taste but the food here seems generally very well made and creative.

It's a little pricey but definitely worth it! They have great food. I personally love the vegan burger, it's huge! The side of potatoes are so good too. Definitely coming back. The cheese cake is great too.

We were seated immediately by the friendly hostess!  The food was beyond delicious, plated beautifully, and the dessert menu was very hard to choose just one item!  I will definitely be going back for more!  :)

This place is a vegan gem in the largely meat-centtic Omaha metro. We had cauliflower buffalo wings as an appetizer and they were fantastic - spicy, crispy, and drizzled with a nice creamy sauce. The Mac and Shrew was delicious - perfectly breaded, crispy tofu over a solid vegan Mac n cheese. The Spicy Marinara Gnocchi was also amazing - very flavorful sauce over soft fluffy potato pasta topped with the best vegan ricotta I've ever tasted. The desserts were also very good - a delicious peanut butter and chocolate pie as well as a tasty sundae with vegan ice cream that beats most dairy ice cream any day. Its kinda expensive but 💯 worth it.
We enjoy eating at Modern Love. Vegan and delicious entrees. A jewel in Omaha.
Amazing vegan food.
Try it! It's great!

Went there about a year ago.  My wife is vegetarian, I am not, but I have eaten a lot of vegetarian and some vegan dishes in my day. The place was packed, so obviously doing well. However, the waitress was borderline rude, and both my wife and myself thought the food to be average and over-priced. Won't be back.
This is a must visit place if you like authentic vegan food!
Great food, must try!
Awesome vegan food. It's a small, cozy place so get here early or have a reservation.

So happy to find a dedicated vegan joint in Omaha, where I never thought I would find one.  I ordered the wings and mac and cheese and loved both of them.  Will definitely be back when I'm in the area.  We did not make a reservation and got lucky to arrive with a table to sit at.  If you plan on going here on a weekend evening, make a reservation!
Awesome experience food was great staff was very accommodating

I've been experimenting with plant based diet and happened to find Modern Love and the menu alone drew me in. Rich, delicious flavors, and mouth feel that rivals the animal versions of their dishes. Oh, and desserts that you can taste by just looking at the menu. Honestly didn't know what to expect. Small with intimate atmosphere, perfect for couples night out. Priced in the medium range but so freaking worth it. Afford yourself the pleasure, you won't regret it.
Amazing Service and Food
Quick and yummy food! Make a reservation!

I'm not a vegan, but was curious when visiting recently. I arrived to a buzzing restaurant and a friendly greeting. The food was really fantastic.. flavours well balanced, dishes innovative.
The service was genuinely friendly and the waiters product knowledge was excellent. Also had a great Iowan beer.
Well done to the owners and staff of this place.. very impressed.
Great friendly staff! Defintly recommended the Mac and shew!
This was awesome food! I'm a vegetarian, but my husband eats meat. We both thought it was outstanding. What a Midwest gem!
Excellent service. Superb food, large portions. Will definitely make another trip from Iowa just to eat there again.

My husband and I drove 7 hours out of the way on our road trip to go to Modern Love. It was so worth it! Our server was wonderful and our meal was incredible. The Brussels sprouts were amazing! I had the Mac and Shews and my husband had the gnocchi. Both were delicious. Definitely save room for dessert too!  This was probably a once in a lifetime experience for us, due to location, but I'm so glad we made the trip. Just a tip though: make sure to make reservations. I'm glad I did, because the space is very small and stays busy.
Great food
great  vegan food
Wonderful food..Vegan menu and nice preparation​
I could eat the Mac & Shews everyday!

The food is amazing! I had the Rangoon, and the BLT and both were exceptional. I was not seated quickly, but it was just an accident. I went on a Sunday evening and there was no need to make a reservation. It is a great place to have a casual, healthy, delicious meal!
Showed up on a Friday night place was packed, we were say right away the service was very good and was very pleased with the food.
Amazing food, warm environment, friendly staff.

I came in to order take out and no one greeted me, I then proceeded to ask if they do carry out and was told yes that she would be with me shortly. I waited for 20 minutes and then a girl told me, "fair warning but it's going to be 45 minutes or more for take out." I said she could have told me that in first place before I waited for 20 minutes and got a huge attitude and told me, not in a nice way to have a good night. This is the first review I have ever written, I just couldn't believe how rude they were.
Piccata was not edible. Other food was ok. I do not recommended this restaurant.

Be sure to download the open table app and reserve a spot, as it can get crowded quickly. As it gets crowded, all diners get intimately acquainted, this is a warning, space gets tight. Parking is easy off of the Main Street (Center) and the food is to die for. Vegans and foodies rejoice!
One of my favorite places in Des Moines.. always great food
Very good food. Not much seating though, so make a reservation.

Cozy and quaint place, food was delicious. But if you have nut allergy you might want to avoid this place? I have a nut allergy but I could tolerate my entree very well. Dessert was very good also. Was worth it.
Loved all the food here!
Hands down best vegan food in Omaha. If you are vegan vegetarian or a meat eater it doesn't matter this food is amazing and will fill you up. Get the Mac and Shews and you will not be disappointed!

Amazing! This is our favorite restaurant in the area- for vegans and omnivores alike! Their seasonal menus bring about some of the best foods that I find myself craving but in a cruelty-free way! Plus, the menu staple of a variation on a Caesar salad (kale, grilled romaine) never disappoints. It is a small place so make reservations!
Excellent food and Their Pina Colada Coconut Cream Pie is to die for, and the service is top notch,everyone there is really nice

The food was amazing, the service was horrible. I would recommend ordering to go, and even then, the woman next to me sat there waiting for her to go order for about 30 minutes.

Food was still great, especially the Modern Burger.
Wonderful variety of awesome vegan cuisine

I was so excited to try this place and left very disappointed. I came here with my family. The atmosphere was less than pleasant, it was very crammed and loud. My mom can't talk very loud at all due to a vocal condition and I couldn't hear a single thing she said basically the entire time. It left everyone a little frustrated. The appetizers were great, we had the buffalo wings and rangoon and I really enjoyed the wings, but then we had to wait over an hour for our food. I was not impressed by the main courses at all. I got the sweet potato enchilada and firstly was extremely confused as to how i was supposed to even eat it. When I started eating it, it was extremely bland. I wasn't a fan. The elote was SMOTHERED in the red chili powder, I mean absolutely smothered. It was ridiculous, you couldn't even see corn through the thick coat of chili powder...I ended up having to scrape it off to make it edible. My boyfriend got the bibimbap which was pretty good but nothing mindblowingly good. Mom and sister got the gyros which I didn't like at all, but they enjoyed. Sisters boyfriend got the burger which I thought was pretty good. All in all, the food was alright but nothing out of this world or stellar, especially for the price.

The service was pretty sub par too. We had a reservation at 8, apparently they close at 9 because we felt very rushed. You can't make us wait for an hour for our food, then rush us because you want to close! I barely took three bites by the time the waitress asked if we wanted boxes, I just said "I have no idea if I will, yet". It was a little annoying. Shortly after she asked if we wanted dessert, I was still barely halfway through my meal so...still...I have no idea if I will! All in all, I probably would not go back especially for that price point.
Good food, Great for vegans or anyone looking for something new to try. Great service, amazing food
Awesome food and staff A++++!
Worth adjusting your schedule & going out of your way (which I did on my cross-country trip)!
All their foods was very delicious specially their salad, it's perfect for my daily diet..
Sadly downgraded my rating. :( I hate to say it but the food hasn't been as good in the past 6-12 months (writing this in June 2017).
Great food and service!
It's like eating in a cozy home with comfort food that is tasty and vegan.

Absolutely amazing all vegan comfort food menu. Offerings change seasonally. Small place so reservations are recommended (though you can usually get a table without one if you don't mind a small wait). Excellent service to pair with the delicious and filling food!
It felt as if I were in a crowded barn. Atmosphere was not comfortable.  I could touch elbows with the people at the next table.  Food was okay at best.

Quite overrated - the food quality and quantity are very low compared to expectations - we are both vegetarian I do believe they rely on the fact that this is the only vegan restaurant in Omaha.Servers were okay but rather cold.
We left a big sum of money there and still felt hungry; frankly the only decent dish was the soup. We will not return and I do not recommend this restaurant to other vvegetarians/vegan people.
Great tasting vegan food!
"Quick service and food was pretty good."

It was really good. I have never had such good vegan food. The cream soda was delicious but way over priced for a tiny thing. Also, I loved the rangoon but they were also overpriced. 10$ for 3 tiny things. But otherwise the burger and gyro were relish.
Delicious
Vegan, interesting
Great service. Enlightened ambiance. Colorful vegan menu. I ordered takeout; however, I think they serve craft beer as well.
I'm so glad this restaurant exists! My fianceé and I would eat here constantly if we could! It's a small quaint place that's great for dinner dates. The seitan wings and any dessert are must haves!

The best vegan recipes I've had - more like great food that just happens to be vegan. Every dish was amazing, and it was so nice to have an entire menu to select from without being concerned about non-vegan ingredients. Worth the cost, 100%!

Hands down the best vegan restaurant, and top 3 best restaurants in general, I have been to. From the decor, to the staff, to the food, and even cocktails, everything was so amazing. 10/10 doctors recommend.
The food is amazing!
Great vegan food. The skill level of the cooking is way beyond what we do at home. It's a great place to learn about vegan options, and delicious as well.

Modern Love is one of my favorite places in Omaha. The menu is eclectic and refreshing, food - delicious and ambiance - quaint. I recommend the Pineapple Coconut Pie, Kale Pesto Gnocchi, Hummus Platter and the Gyros. Yum! Will definitely be back for more.
Exactly what it should be.
Loved it!!! Best vegan mac and cheese I've ever had. Service was great. It would be best to book ahead, from what I saw this place regularly fills up with locals.
Incredible vegan food, right here in Omaha.
Great food!
I highly recommend this place. Great food and friendly staff! Even if you are a meat eater you should definitely try it.
Great vegan dishes.
Great atmosphere! wonderful little out of the way hidden gem

I absolutely love Modern Love!! The options are amazing! The food is so creative! You can tell they put a lot of thought and effort behind each dish. Expensive but worth it. I haven't disliked anything on their menu.
Best food in the area. The restaurant will make you wish you were vegan, even if you're a meat lover. Balanced, plant based meals that leave you satisfied and coming back for more.

Best vegan resteraurant in town!  Ok, it's the only vegan resteraurant in town...but it could compete with any place in Seattle or Portland.
I would recommend a reservation on Friday or Saturday.  The place is rather small and always packed on the weekends  (which I admit - I wasn't expecting).
If you need vegan, this is the place. I'm an omnivore, but I still thought the food was good. Very pricey though, especially if you don't need the veganness.
hell yeah
Fantastic vegetarian restaurant.   Make a reservation beforehand.   You will not be disappointed in the food!
No meat? No problem! I love meat and the fact that there is none here doesn't matter to me. This place is amazing.
The service and food was great! As a meat eater I still found a number of things on the menu that I was interested in and everything we had was delicious!!

Had a wonderful kale salad and service was friendly. But the tables were a little too close for comfort and I feel the pricing is too high for Omaha. I realize the chef is outstanding, and ingredients were perfect freshness, but just sayin. However it was packed so if the market bears the pricing maybe it's ok.

I loved this place. First of all a Vegan place in Midwest., rarest thing to see. Second me being almost vegan(excluding dairy) loved the idea. Third seeing great reviews gave positive vibes. We went and ordered couple of dishes. The food is close to Indian food presented in American style. Place is small but didn't bother us much. Friendly service. One more thing every body said about is main course, however even the hot chocolate tasted great there. Price was a little higher end for me,but with the taste, yeah it is worth..
Delicious, vegan/ vegetarian food, yummy deserts.
The food is perfect and all of the staff members are awesome!

I adore Modern Love, and I have since my very first time there. I have a dairy allergy, and this is the only restaurant in Omaha that I can eat at without worrying about accidentally being served dairy.

Back when they first opened they didn't serve alcohol, but now they have a limited selection of beers, wines, and cocktails. I was not impressed with the rosé I had with my dinner, but the food was incredible. I had the chana masala, and the portion was so generous that I got three whole meals out of it.

When we were packing up our leftovers, our two leftover seitan "wings" (totally delicious, BTW) fell on the floor. Our waitress noticed and the kitchen made up a whole new order for us to take home! I was really impressed with that little touch of kindness. And oh my goodness, the desserts...they are ridiculously good. ALL OF THEM. I've never had a bad experience or a bad meal here.

This delicious haunt is not only appealing to those who are vegan, but anybody looking for a quality meal with locally sourced ingredients and a fresh approach to some classic dishes. My personal favorite are the huevos rancheros. The tofu has a wonderful texture and everything is extremely flavorful, including the cherry tomatoes that come on the side. You really can't go wrong at this place. Bring a friend, have a mimosa, and enjoy the great tunes on this awesome place's soundtrack.
Fantastic vegan restaurant I went to with a large group of friends.  The pot pie is to die for as are the desserts.

Food was full of flavor and had wonderful texture. We ordered the Farmer's Market Shepards Pie, the Modern Cheeseburger, Pear and Fig Pie, and the Fat Elvis Pie. This restaurant makes me want to go vegan!!
This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Omaha. Always a great menu and it changes frequently.
Superb
Fantastic comfort food whether you are vegan or not. If you come on the weekend, make reservations as the place is small and popular.
Great food, and good atmosphere, just be sure to make reservations.
Amazing Vegan food with a rotating menu.

Fantastic!  Friday, August 19, 2016 5pm reservations to celebrate my 65th and my daughter's birthday...arriving during a drenching summer rainstorm...great experience!

As a writer and transitioner to a more vegan way, as well as being quite plump, it was my first visit;  and I was so happily surprised with the unique intimate space, colorful...yet even more perky and colorful were the savory & satisfying dishes we chose.  Mine was the Seitan BBQ Cookout.  Visual and culinary art!

From beer, appetizers, entrees, to the most heavenly vegan-chocolate-cheesecake---no dairy cheese but even better.  The four of us had fun, ate like healthy royalty, and were spoiled by efficient and friendly service.
Reservations or takeout, this cozy and cheerful establishment is a real gem in Omaha. ♡
Breakfast was great, definitely recommend!
Food was really good and the server was very nice.

I wasn't really interested in the motivation behind this place. I love eating meat, dairy, eggs, and I feel okay towards vegetables. I laughed out loud when someone first proposed I eat here. I disliked the angle on this place and the clientele that I believed it was designed to attract. I don't have arm tattoos, listen to and brag about underground music, have out of the norm piercings, wear deep-Vs, ride a bike, have a beard, or wear plaid ever.

That being said, this restaurant is fantastic and worthy of all the praise it's been getting. The veggie burger is, as another review wrote, "very scrumptious".  It was nicely crusted on the outside and not a pureed mash in the middle and instead nicely textured. The curried falafel with rice pilaf was one of the best chickpea concoctions I've ever had. Mac & Shew? Don't think about it twice, just get it and be ready to woof it down. I can't say anything about drink, salad, and dessert quality.

The interior is lovingly decorated with light artwork and seasonal table decorations. The staff is attentive, friendly, and ready to explain any questions you might have, even if you have a lot of them since you don't know anything about cashew butter, seitan, tofu, or kale. Parking can be tight and the space inside is close, so there's no need to yell like you're in a sports bar.

If you're thinking that you're at least a little open-minded and less of a jerk than you actually are, give it a shot and hopefully you'll be overwhelmingly pleasantly surprised like I was. Way to go Modern Love!

Modern Love has fantastic food made from high-quality, local ingredients. Everything is fresh, homemade, and delicious. Oh, and it's vegan. That can just be a side note because it's amazingly tasty food that will appeal to omnivores as well as vegetarians of all types. The only downside of Modern Love is the tiny, cramped atmosphere. It is a lovely space, but much too small for a quiet dinner. Also, reservations are a must! I hope that they continue to grow and expand. I could then happily give 5 stars.
Disappointing

Good food, excellent service. But the parking lot is a mess, and tables and chairs are awkwardly stuffed into each room. Our meal was also three times more expensive than any other place I've ever eaten in Omaha. It's not a bad place to eat, but not worth the hassles.

I and a friend ordered a Modern Cheeseburger that consisted of a lentil patty, smoky cashew cheddar, dill pickles, tomato, whole wheat bun, fatty fries, miso ketchup. When our plates arrived everything looked very tasty and then when I took a bite the lentil patty squeezed out of the sides and oozed out onto my finger's and fell onto my plate. I was expecting a patty that was firm and not soft. It also was a red color and looked like a raw hamburger. The flavor was very bland and the only thing that tasted some what eatable was the bun, but even it was too hard. It also had lettuce that was not fresh and was wilted. The potato's that came with it where cut to thick and even the root-beer drink we ordered didn't taste right. We had a pitcher of water at our table and there was no ice in it and it tasted like tap water. It is a small place and the seating was very limited and the tables were too close together. I told the lady that served us that the food didn't taste good and she told us she appreciated the feedback and would let the cook know. No apologize at all. I have been vegetarian for 15 yrs and I have ate countless veggie burgers and what was served to us was not a burger. We should have just left after the first bite of our food and not paid almost $50 dollars for the worst meal I have ever had. Both of us suffered from sick stomachs for several hours after eating part of the burgers. I was really expecting a good meal based on the reviews I read but had a completely opposite experience,
Can't rave enough about this place. I've been dreaming about the delicious food since I went. Follow them on Facebook for drool-worthy photos that will surely make you secure a reservation.

Fantastic food and excellent service. I highly recommend the wings. My wife owns most of the proprietor's cookbooks, and after we informed the hostess of this, we were delighted to have Isa Chandra Moskowitz deliver our dinner herself. We will definitely be dining here again!

Poor customer service.  No hours posted

I arrived early.  At least 4 employees looked out the window and immediately looked away instead of offering  assistance.

Amazing! We started with hummus, which is such a simple dish, yet Modern Love elevated it into a really wonderful appetizer with a few simple touches. For an entree I tried gnocchi; this is generally served as a heavier plate with sauce, like a pasta dish, but Modern Love's version was more like a delicious soup, comfort food with a fresh lemon taste - it was fantastic, I've never had anything like it, and I can't wait to return. My dinning partners had an Indian dish and their Mac and Cheese - both were superb. We split a "cheesecake" for desert and we're delighted. Modern Love has elevated vegan dining to more than a "style" of dining or a life choice - they stand on their own amongst the best restaurants in Omaha.
Every single bite was delicious.

Let me start with I am not a vegan, nor a vegetarian. My wife made plans to meet others here and I went along not knowing what to expect.  What I found was one of the best tasting meals I have had in a long time. I had a bean/quinoa burger followed by a mojito cheesecake and both were out of this world! I will definitely be back.

I am a born vegetarian. I travel for work quite frequently and I like to explore vegan/vegetarian restaurants while traveling so that I can eat healthy and also support these restaurants. While in Omaha, I was looking for such restaurants and the only one that I could find online was Modern Love.

To be honest, I wasn't sure how it would be and what to expect, but I still gave it a try. Finding the restaurant wasn't hard, the GPS was able to take me there easily. The restaurant is inside what looks like a small warehouse or car repair shop at an intersection. The parking could be a problem on a busy evening, as it is shared with another restaurant. The interior is modern and casual, but they have limited seating, so reservations are recommended.

I order the soup of the day, which was a creamy potato peas soup with fresh potato chips on top...absolutely delightful and tasty!
